sec.p: One hundred and six participants were included in Round 1 and 46 (43%) responded. Eight respondents excluded themselves on the basis of ill-health, limited access/time or inadequate expertise. This left 38 (36%) respondents who submitted a completed response.

After removal of duplicates from Round 1, 100 potential priority research areas and questions ( Figure S3) remained that fell into six broad categoriesâ€” i.e., food systems and security; urban design, transport and housing; economics trade and business; social justice; behaviour, communication and information systems; and regulation, governance and policy.
